content.title: It is kept open for 12 hours (8.00 am to 8.00 pm) with Internet browsing facility for all its users.

items: Won Second prize in the poster presentation in the Two days State Level Confederacy organized by Anna University, Chennai on 08.02.2018 and 09.02.2018.
R.Deepak, IV year Civil was nominated for International Youth Exchange Programme held at China by the Government of India during 2017-18.
A MoU was signed between NSS unit and Edudharma for funding various activities through NSS.
S.T.Nivetha, ECE received “Best NSS Volunteer Award” by the NSS Cell, Anna University, Chennai for the Academic year 2017-18.
R.Deepak, Civil received “Best NSS Volunteer Award” by the NSS Cell, Anna University, Chennai for the Academic year 2017-18.
A MoU was signed between NSS unit and Nizhal Mayyam for funding various activities through NSS.

Youth Parliament: 104 volunteers participated and our college has won “Best group” and  Ms.J.Bindhu, III year EEE had won “Best Speaker Award” along with a cash prize of Rs.2,000 and Mr.S.Pallavaraj , III year EEE had won “Best Speaker Award” along with a “Sony” headset.
Election Duty: 11 Volunteers participated in the election duty during 2015-16.
Swaach Bharat Mission: A team of 51 volunteers organized Swaach Bharat Mission Programme and Soft Skills training programme for School children at Kundah Kothagiri, The Nilgiris.
Traffic Regulation Work, Ooty: A team of 10 boys volunteers are involved in Traffic regulation work at Ooty on all Saturdays and Sundays w.e.f 26.11.2016.

Soft Skills Training Programme for tribal children: A team of 4 girls are involved in Soft Skills Training Programme for Panchayat Union Public School at Yellanalli, Ooty on all alternate Saturdays w.e.f 26.01.2017.
Set up of a Library for tribal children: A library with 500 books was inaugurated for the benefit of tribal children at Kundah Kothagiri, The Nilgiris.
One day Workshop: First Aid Training and Demonstration.
Dr. P. Lakshmana Kumar, received the “Best NSS Programme Officer” award for the year 2020-21 by the NSS Cell, Anna University, Chennai
Dr. P. Lakshmana Kumar, NSS Programme officer received Best Social Activist Award for tribal welfare activities at Nilgiris by ABJ Trust, Sivakisi
NSS volunteers Mr.S.Kavin Raja and Ms.K.Kiruba Devi attended the “National Integration Camp” held at Jammu University, Jammu from 22nd to 28th February 2020
Ms.S.T.Nivetha received Indira Gandhi Award for the year 2017 – 2018
